==Chinese==
{{zh-forms}}

===Glyph origin===
{{Han etyl}}
{{liushu|p}} – a footprint, originally meaning "toe". The derivative {{och-l|趾}} refers to the original meaning. Compare {{zh-l|*手|hand}}. Note that in oracle script, composed of 3 toes and a sole.

Compare to {{zh-l|*夊}}, {{zh-l|*夂}}, which have similar shape in oracle script, but pointing down (toe pointing right), and {{zh-l|*𡕒}} (as in right side of {{zh-l|*舛}}, roughly {{zh-l|*ヰ}}, toe pointing left), hence different evolution.
